p: The SAS questionnaire was used to measure the levels of anxiety of the study participants. There were 20 items in the scale. Each item was divided into four grades according to the feelings of the respondents in the past week and the frequency of symptoms was mainly evaluated. The cumulative score of 20 items was the total SAS score. The standard total score was obtained by taking the total score ×1.25. The higher the score, the greater the degree of anxiety [ 18]. The Cronbach’s alpha for internal consistency of this questionnaire was previously determined to be 0.867.
